greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Another version of triangular array in A062991 unsigned and transposed : triangle T(n,k), 0<=k<=n, read by rows; given by [0, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, ...] DELTA [1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, ...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938.
comment: Diagonals: A000007, A000108, 2*A001700; A000108, A002694. Row sums: A064092 (generalized Catalan C(2; n).
link: P. Barry, A Note on a Family of Generalized Pascal Matrices Defined by Riordan Arrays, Journal of Integer Sequences, 16 (2013), #13.5.4.
Yue Cai, Catherine Yan, Counting with Borel's triangle, Texas A&M University.
Yue Cai, Catherine Yan, Counting with Borel's triangle, arXiv:1804.01597 [math.CO], 2018.
B. Derrida, E. Domany and D. Mukamel, A exact solution of a one-dimensional asymmetric exclusion model with open boundaries, J. Stat. Phys. 69, 1992, 667-687; eqs.(20), (21), p. 672.
formula: Sum_{k = 0..n} T(n, k)*x^(n-k) = C(x+1; n), generalized Catalan numbers; see left diagonals of triangle A064094: A000012, A000108, A064062..63, A064087..93 for x = -1, 0, ..., 9, respectively.
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Binomial[2n, k-1] Binomial[2n-k-1, n-k]/n; T[0, 0] = 1;
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 19 2018 *)
xref: See also A234950 for another version. - _Philippe Deléham_, Jan 11 2014
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Jun 03 2004, Jun 14 2007
